div.p:
Welcome to the Lebanon Special School District. Our district serves
over 4,000 students in grades Pre-Kindergarten through Eighth grade.
Our school system is served by over 500 dedicated men and women who are
"Committed to a Community of Excellence" for all of our students. READ MORE

td.a: LSSD Schools Closing for the Remainder of the Year
td.br: In light of today’s announcement by Governor Lee, schools will remain closed for the remainder of the year. However, as a district, we will continue to carry out the plans that we already have in place: encouraging and supporting students and families, feeding our children, and keeping our students connected to learning through the remainder of the school calendar - May 22. Please see the attached Press Release for additional information.

td.a: Revised Feeding Schedule Begins Monday April 6
td.br: At the recommendation of the state to limit potential exposure to COVID 19, we have revised our feeding schedule. The new schedule will begin next Monday, April 6. Locations and times will remain the same; however, we will only distribute meals on Monday and Thursday. You will receive “heat and serve” meals to have at home for approximately three days on each pickup day. Meal storage and heating instructions will be included with all meals. Please see the attached flyer for details.

There will be a Community Food Giveaway on Saturday, April 4, at the Wilson County Fairgrounds (enter at the James E. Ward Ag Center) beginning at 8:00 a.m. until all food has been distributed. LSSD Family Resource Director, Beth Petty, will be on site assisting with the food distribution. Please share this information with families or friends that may be in need.

td.a: Student Transfer Request 2020-2021 Window Open Now thru May 1, 2020
td.br: Students whose parent or legal guardian resides within the Lebanon Special School District may request a student transfer to a school other than the zoned school according to the following guidelines.

td.a: Coronavirus Update - Safer at Home Activity Postponement
td.br: Today Governor Lee asked all Tennesseans to evaluate and cease all activities that are non-essential. As a district, we want to do our part to keep students, families, and faculty healthy and safe. In light of that, LSSD will temporarily postpone all non-essential activities. We will continue our efforts to feed our children and provide them with academic materials and supports, but all other events and gatherings, including parades, will now be suspended.

td.a: Update to Free Breakfast and Lunch Feeding Schedule
td.br: Due to the closing of Don Fox Park and continued efforts to encourage social distancing, LSSD meals that have been distributed at the park will now be available from 10:30-11:30 a.m. at Castle Heights Elementary, 1007 Castle Heights Avenue North. Please look for signs which will direct you around the left side of the main drive. All other sites and times will remain the same.
